title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Early Warning System,"  Front Side", ca. 1987
medium: Felt-tip marking pens, photocopied image on white tracing paper.
inscribed: Inscribed in black marking pen, lower center, right:  "Early Warning System"/Front side; upper center:  [left arrow]Flashing /Light; [left arrow] Target/(revolving?); right center:  [left arrow] Photo of/Cruise Missle (sic); at lower left:  3.[encircled]
description: Three panel screen screen on wheels.   Left and center panels, painted with blue and black checks, form a square which is intersected at right edge by a orange triangular panel.  On top of checked panels is a red, zig-zag hao (left) and a green target (right).  On left-most panel, a yellow lightning bolt at left edge and a map of Europe with population centers in red dots. Orange triangle has square deliniated on it to mark placement of cruise missile photograph, taped to right of screen.
